intro: Navarretia jepsonii, commonly known as Jepson's navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, narrow leaves and produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Navarretia jepsonii is often found in coastal and inland areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
